definition: smell of gunpowder/(fig.) combative tone/belligerence
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
surname Huo
medicine/drug/substance used for a specific purpose (e.g. poisoning, explosion, fermenting)/CL:種|种[zhong3],服[fu4],味[wei4]/to poison
leaf of the iris/variant of 藥|药[yao4]
taste/smell/(fig.) (noun suffix) feel/quality/sense/(TCM) classifier for ingredients of a medicine prescription
strong smell of gunpowder/fig. tense situation/standoff

sentences.english: I can smell the gunpowder all the way up here in the cockpit.
sentences.chinese: 一路上我都可以从驾驶舱里闻到火药味。

sentences.english: It was a day of tense and often ill- tempered debate.
sentences.chinese: 那天的辩论紧张激烈，常常火药味十足。

sentences.english: This is perhaps the most militarized Buddhist enclave in the world.
sentences.chinese: 这里或许是世界上火药味最浓的佛教地区。

sentences.english: "To give lip" means to be too militant in your speech.
sentences.chinese: “说硬话”是指讲话火药味太浓。

sentences.english: On that exciting night, air was filled with a strong smell of gunpowder .
sentences.chinese: 在那个激动人心的夜晚，空气中充满了火药味。

sentences.english: And they will look at your hands. You smell of powder. Shot.
sentences.chinese: 他们会叫你伸出手来看，发现手上有火药味，就枪毙。

sentences.english: He teed off on the selection committee in an illtempered article.
sentences.chinese: 他在一篇火药味很浓的文章中攻击选拔委员会。

definition: lit. with swords drawn and bows bent (idiom); fig. a state of mutual hostility/at daggers drawn
smoke (from guns)
war of words
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
sharply opposed to each other, with neither prepared to give an inch (idiom)
dispute/spat/shouting match
fight a battle of words/cross verbal swords
skirmish/clash/dispute/brush
war of words
could happen at any moment/on the verge
to meet/to run into (sb)/to get together (with sb)
to turn white-hot/to intensify/to reach a climax
jealousy (in love rivalry)
enmity/hostility
gratitude and grudges/resentment/grudges/grievances
murderous spirit/aura of death/to vent one's anger
